page.title: 15Woodlands
page.content: In our area there are woodlands at Bicton, Penharget, Ashlake, Trelawney, Tokenbury and Browda. Most of these are deciduous woods of{oak}and{beech, but some is now being felled and replanted with{conifers,}especially at Bicton. These woodlands are mostly around the course of the{River Lynher}and have been registered as areas of{Great {Landscape Value}(GLV) and{Outstanding {Natural Beauty}(ONB). They provide a home for many creatures such as squirrels, foxes, badgers, stoats, weasels, mink, rabbits, mice and voles, as well as large numbers and varieties of birds. {Jennifer Lee Hunt. {Lianne Geraldine Williams.
